title: YouTube to pay $22 million in settlement with Trump
subhead: The Google subsidiary is the latest Big Tech firm to settle with Trump after his posting privileges were suspended in 2021 on multiple platforms following the January 6 attack on the Capitol that year.

title: Sarkozy verdict reveals complicated relationship between the French, politicians and judges
subhead: Following the conviction of France's former president, attacks on judges have returned to the political discourse. Yet this court decision is also the result of growing public demand for integrity.

title: Anesthesia's remarkable journey since the 19th century
subhead: An exhibition at the Museum of the History of Medicine in Paris traces the saga of this medical specialty, from its beginnings to the major advances that transformed medical practice.

title: Paris struggles to curb car traffic without alienating road users
subhead: Since 2020, Paris has undertaken a series of street redesigns aimed at restricting motorized traffic. These 'traffic plans' have been adjusted district by district, drawing heavy criticism from the opposition.

title: Svalbard, the fastest-warming place on Earth
subhead: 'Our planet at +1.5°C' (1/6). The Norwegian archipelago has warmed by 4°C over the past 30 years. Landslides and thawing permafrost threaten the population, whose way of life is highly greenhouse gas-intensive.
byline: By Audrey Garric (Longyearbyen (Norway) special correspondent) and Adrienne Surprenant

title: Italy's Meloni hardens rhetoric after killing of Charlie Kirk
subhead: Since the assassination of Trump ally Chalie Kirk, the Italian prime miniser has embraced darker, more polarized themes, invoking conspiracies and casting herself as a target of political violence.

title: 'Get up or I'll smash you': Protests in France were  marked by police brutality
subhead: Testimonies revealed the violence committed during the protests organized by the 'Block Everything' movement and a coalition of unions. Lawyers criticized 'extremely incomplete files' for the arrests conducted and denounce 'preventive police custody.'
